messages.title: A future fair for all
messages.content: I will ensure you have an MP you can trust and will represent you with integrity and hard work.

messages.title: A new start in Bromsgrove
messages.content: Bromsgrove needs a new start. My commitment is to work hard for the people of Bromsgrove, to listen to your concerns and be available and approachable.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A new politics for Bromsgrove built on transparency and integrity.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Sam Burden emphasizes the need for a new political approach that prioritizes transparency and integrity.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Securing the economic recovery - support for families and local businesses and promoting jobs.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: He focuses on supporting families, local businesses, and promoting job growth for economic recovery.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protecting front line services like health and education.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promises to protect essential public services such as health care and education.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fighting for an independent Bromsgrove not a Greater Redditch authority.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Advocates for Bromsgrove's independence and opposes being part of a greater Redditch authority.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: More affordable housing so young people do not have to move away from their families and roots.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promotes the development of affordable housing to enable young people to stay close to their families and roots.

mentions.candidate: Sam Burden is a Labour Candidate for Bromsgrove who stands for a fair future and promises integrity and hard work as an MP.

issues.economy: Sam Burden is committed to economic recovery and supporting families and local businesses.
issues.education: He emphasizes protecting front line services like education.
issues.governance: Promoting a new politics built on transparency and integrity.
issues.health: Pledging to protect front line services like health.

housing.content: He is focused on more affordable housing to support the community.

leaflet.personalStatement: Sam Burden shares his commitment to working hard, being available and approachable, and standing up for the interests of Bromsgrove in the West Midlands and at Westminster.

contactInformation.address: 21 Shaw Lane, Stoke Prior, Bromsgrove B60 4DP

quotes.text: I will ensure you have an MP you can trust and will represent you with integrity and hard work.

images.caption: Sam Burden pictured with residents at Charford First School - A Sure Start Children's Cen

leaflet.additionalNotes: This leaflet has been printed from mixed sources and is a part of a campaign by Sam Burden for the Labour candidacy in Bromsgrove.
